author: Paul Rankin
method: Heat the oil in a pan and gently fry the onion, ginger and garlic for 3-4 minutes, or until softened. Stir in the peppers and cook for a further 2-3 minutes, then add the choi sum, soy sauce and sesame oil. Stir well and cook for a further 2-3 minutes, or until the choi sum is wilted.  Spoon the stir-fry into a bowl and serve.
ingredients: 1 tbsp vegetable oil,  ½ onion, sliced ,  1 tbsp chopped fresh root ginger,  1 garlic clove, chopped,  ½ red pepper, cut into strips,  ½ yellow pepper, cut into strips,  1 leaf choi sum, shredded,  2 tbsp soy sauce,  1 tbsp sesame oil
